comment: The second Chebyshev function is the sum of the theta function at arguments quickly approaching zero. (This is usually stated as an infinite sum, but after a certain point, the terms are all zero, and it is easier for us to use an explicit finite sum.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)
